main event: A weatherman and other witnesses in Sioux City, Iowa reported seeing a saucer-shaped object moving at a high speed and flashing out of sight in a second and a half. The U.S. Air Force denied any knowledge of the saucer reports.
interesting points: The object was described as saucer-shaped, moving at a tremendous speed, and flashing out of sight in a second and a half.
The witnesses included a weatherman and other individuals from the U.S. Weather Bureau.

The Project Blue Book report lists various UFO sightings and observations from April, May, and June 1950, in locations such as Boston, Mass., Chandler, Ariz., Summerville, S. Carolina, and other areas.
The report contains information on seven alleged sightings of unidentified flying objects forwarded by various USAF flight service center units, all occurring in the US during March 1950.

The physical evidence mentioned in the report refers to a possible collision with an A/C during a T-6 A/C flight, where the object appeared to be about Â½ the size of the A/C and moved rapidly, shaped like a small parachute, but made no noise.
sighted object: saucer-shaped object moving at a high speed
witnesses: weatherman, U.S. Weather Bureau employees, and other individuals
photographs: no photographs available in the report
